content_blocks.title: Advanced Topic Ahead

content.text: You're about to learn Pass-the-Hash and Pass-the-Ticket, an advanced technique used by real-world threat actors and security professionals. This knowledge is powerful and must be used ethically.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Think of this like learning advanced martial arts - powerful, but requires responsibility.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: This technique is actively used in real-world attacks and defenses.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: How would you use this knowledge to improve security?

content_blocks.title: Pass-the-Hash and Pass-the-Ticket

content.text: This lesson covers: NTLM hash reuse, Ticket reuse, Lateral movement, Credential theft. These are advanced techniques requiring solid fundamentals.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Core concept: NTLM hash reuse enables attackers (or defenders) to lateral movement without passwords.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Real threat actors use Pass-the-Hash and Pass-the-Ticket daily in active campaigns.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: What security controls could prevent or detect this technique?

post_assessment.question: What is Pass-the-Hash?
options: Authenticating with hash instead of password
post_assessment.explanation: Pass-the-Hash uses the NTLM hash directly for authentication without knowing the plaintext password.

post_assessment.question: How does Pass-the-Ticket differ from Pass-the-Hash?
options: PtT uses Kerberos tickets instead of NTLM hashes
post_assessment.explanation: Pass-the-Ticket reuses Kerberos tickets for authentication, while PtH uses NTLM hashes.
